precontext: John was dining at his favorite local café, enjoying a quiet meal. He chatted with the friendly staff who knew him well. As he finished his dessert, he stood up to leave.
sentence: After the meal, he accidentally tipped the table on his way out.
meanings_considered: cause to topple or tumble by pushing
give a tip or gratuity to in return for a service, beyond the compensation agreed on
explanation:
• "Tipped the table" in the context of dining and leaving is a common expression meaning to move or shift the table, which fits the physical sense of "cause to topple"  
• The phrase "tipped the table" in this setting is idiomatic and does not logically refer to giving a gratuity, as giving a tip would be a separate, distinct action not described here  
• Giving a gratuity (meaning 2) is not supported by the context—there is no mention of money, service, or a server, and the action described is physical movement during exit
clear_meaning_text: cause to topple or tumble by pushing
